Remembering The Khoi and San People

A brief superficial summary

The purpose of this tribute page is to highlight the often overlooked distinction between the Khoekhoe(khoikhoi) and San peoples who inhabited what is now known as Cape Town and bring attention to the fact that there is no one group of Khoisan people, it is more an oversimplification for convenience-sake. There seems be a biased view of the mainstream media towards the colonists who settled in the Cape which has resulted in an unjustified dismissal of everything that took place before their arrival, which casts a shadow on the history, heritage and culture of the people who most likely are the real indigenes of the Cape.
My intention is not academic in nature, but simply to shine a light on this biased view, which I too was fed, and state that there is sufficient reason to re-examine and further explore the literature and human resources available to develop a more complete and un-biased picture of our history and the people who came before us.

  • 2500 years ago - Khoi originate on the perimeter of the Kalahari
  • By 300AD - Migration into the Gariep and eventually the Eastern Cape
  • 15Th century - First permanent settlement in the Cape peninsula
  • 1613 - Chief Xhore kidnapped to England
  • 1615 - English attempt to settle at Camissa(Table Bay)
  • 1631 - Chief Autshumao taken to visit Batavia(Jakarta)
  • 1638 - First village and port operation along Camissa river mouth
  • 1652 - First Dutch Settlment in the Cape

For a more in depth look at the vast history of these clans Visit Camissa People
